In the last 20 years, only 19 cases have been described in the literature. All reported cases had significant predisposing conditions including diabetes mellitus, malignancy, use of catheters, etc. However, the association between cellulitis of tinea pedis and fluconazole-resistant K. ohmeri has not been described.
